result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael Dale Counard was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Straight Time if imposed.
Consecutive to:
Probation may be transferred to Milwaukee County.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment or counseling recommended by agent. Maintain absolute sobriety. Comply with random urine screens. Maintain employment and/or school combination. 
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: Non-working hours. Releases for standard conditions. STAYED for use at agent's discretion.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Michael Dale Counard
Current: 740 N. 29th Street   #205, Milwaukee, WI 53208 United States  (Effective: 10-21-2015)
Prior: 1111 S. 6th St, C/O United Community Center, Milwaukee, WI 53204 United States
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Michael Dale Counard in court with Attorney Nicole Williams Buttery.  Michele W. Hulgaard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count #1.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #1.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Williams Buttery makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:     IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

90 DAYS STRAIGHT TIME     **consecutive**

TERM OF PROBATION:  1 YEAR         -May be transferred to Milwaukee County- 

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 

COSTS:  $243.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation)

CONDITION TIME:   30 Days, Non-working hours with standard release conditions - STAYED - to be used at agent's discretion
Notice of Hearing returned, for hearing scheduled on: 10/21/15.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 10-21-2015 09:00 am

Defendant Michael Dale Counard in court with Attorney Nicole Williams Buttery.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Williams Buttery requests a plea and sentence date.   Bail remains as fixed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 21, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Hearing on September 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Michael Dale Counard in court with attorney Nicole Williams Buttery.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Williams Buttery requests another hearing date.   Bail remains as fixed. Hearing scheduled for September 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.
